messages.content:
You are a professional academic reference prediction expert. Your task is to predict the most likely references for a given academic paper based on its title, abstract, and retrieved relevant papers.

RETRIEVER INTERFACE:
- Input: paper title + abstract
- Output: {top_r} retrieved papers with title and abstract
- Format: List of dictionaries with 'title' and 'abstract' fields

REQUIREMENTS:
1. Analyze the paper's title and abstract to understand its research area and focus
2. Consider the retrieved papers as potential references (when available)
3. Generate a list of predicted reference titles that would be most relevant and likely to be cited
4. Provide reasoning for each prediction to prevent hallucination
5. Output format: JSON object with "titles" array and "reasoning" string
6. Generate exactly 52 most relevant reference titles (this should be at least 40 to cover all evaluation metrics)
7. Ensure titles are realistic and appropriate for the research area
8. Consider citation patterns in the field
9. CRITICAL: Each title must be unique - never repeat the same title multiple times

EXAMPLE:
Input:
Title: "Question Type Classification Methods Comparison"
Abstract: "The paper presents a comparative study of state-of-the-art approaches for question classification task: Logistic Regression, Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN), Long Short-Term Memory Network (LSTM) and Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks (QRNN). All models use pre-trained GLoVe word embeddings and trained on human-labeled data. The best accuracy is achieved using CNN model with five convolutional layers and various kernel sizes stacked in parallel, followed by one fully connected layer. The model reached 90.7% accuracy on TREC 10 test set."

Retrieved papers ({top_r}):
1. Title: Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification
   Abstract: We report on a series of experiments with convolutional neural networks trained on top of pre-trained word vectors for sentence-level classification tasks.

2. Title: Glove: Global vectors for word representation
   Abstract: We present a new global log-bilinear regression model that combines the advantages of the two major model families in the literature.

Output:
{
  "titles": [
    "Convolutional Neural Networks for Sentence Classification",
    "Glove: Global vectors for word representation",
    "Quasi-Recurrent Neural Networks",
    "A Comparative Study of Neural Network Models for Sentence Classification",
    "Deep lstm based feature mapping for query classification"
  ],
  "reasoning": "Based on the paper's focus on question classification using neural networks, I predict these references because: 1) CNN paper is directly relevant to the convolutional approach used; 2) GloVe embeddings are mentioned as pre-trained features; 3) QRNN is one of the compared methods; 4) Comparative study papers are common in this field; 5) LSTM-based query classification is closely related to question classification. Additional references cover related neural network architectures, NLP applications, deep learning methodologies, optimization techniques, and advanced neural network methods that would be relevant for this research area."
}

Return JSON object only.

Paper Title: GBSVM: Granular-ball Support Vector Machine

Paper Abstract: Abstract GBSVM (Granular-ball Support Vector Machine) is a significant attempt to construct a classifier using the coarse-to-fine granularity of a granular-ball as input, rather than a single data point. It is the first classifier whose input contains no points. However, the existing model has some errors, and its dual model has not been derived. As a result, the current algorithm cannot be implemented or applied. To address these problems, this paper has fixed the errors of the original model of the existing GBSVM, and derived its dual model. Furthermore, a particle swarm optimization algorithm is designed to solve the dual model. The sequential minimal optimization algorithm is also carefully designed to solve the dual model. The solution is faster and more stable than the particle swarm optimization based version. The experimental results on the UCI benchmark datasets demonstrate that GBSVM has good robustness and efficiency. All codes have been released in the open source library at http://www.cquptshuyinxia.com/GBSVM.html or https://github.com/syxiaa/GBSVM.

{retrieved_text}

Generate exactly 52 most likely reference titles for this paper. Focus on papers that are directly related to the research topic, provide foundational background, present similar methodologies, or address related problems.

CRITICAL: Each title must appear exactly once. Do not repeat any title.

IMPORTANT: You must respond with ONLY valid JSON in this exact format:
{
    "titles": [
        "Reference Title 1",
        "Reference Title 2",
        "Reference Title 3",
        "Reference Title 4",
        "Reference Title 52"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Explain why you chose these specific references based on the paper's title, abstract, and retrieved papers. This helps prevent hallucination and ensures relevance."
}

Do not include any text before or after the JSON. Do not include authors, venues, or years - only the paper titles. The reasoning field is required to explain your prediction logic.

{
    "titles": [
        "Topological structure in visual perception",
        "Multi-granularity stock prediction with sequential three-way decisions",
        "Double-quantitative distance measurement and classification learning based on the tri-level granular structure of neighborhood system",
        "Allocation of information granularity in optimization and decision-making models: Towards building the foundations of granular computing",
        "A trilevel analysis of uncertainty measuresin partition-based granular computing",
        "Multi granularity based label propagation with active learning for semi-supervised classification",
        "Methods and practices of three-way decisions for complex problem solving",
        "Granular ball computing classifiers for efficient, scalable and robust learning",
        "Integrating variable reduction strategy with evolutionary algorithms for solving nonlinear equations systems",
        "Trend-based granular representation of time series and its application in clustering",
        "A multi-granularity cognitive computing model bidirectionally driven by knowledge and data",
        "Granular ball computing: an efficient, robust, and interpretable adaptive multi-granularity representation and computation method",
        "Weight-and-universum-based semi-supervised multi-view learning machine",
        "Ball k-means: Fast adaptive clustering with no bounds",
        "An efficient ls-svm-based method for fuzzy system construction",
        "Twin support vector machines for pattern classification",
        "Twin support vector machine: theory, algorithm and applications",
        "Proximal support vector machine classifiers",
        "Generalized elastic net lp-norm nonparallel support vector machine",
        "A novel projection twin support vector machine for binary classification",
        "ŒΩùúà u-projection twin support vector machine for pattern classification",
        "Intuitionistic fuzzy weighted least squares twin svms",
        "Multiview learning with robust double-sided twin svm",
        "A transfer-based additive ls-svm classifier for handling missing data",
        "Semisupervised learning via axiomatic fuzzy set theory and svm",
        "A robust projection twin support vector machine with a generalized correntropy-based loss",
        "Twin-parametric margin support vector machine with truncated pinball loss",
        "The dual model of support vector machine based on granular ball computing",
        "Parameters selection and application of support vector machines based on particle swarm optimization algorithm",
        "Sequential minimal optimization: A fast algorithm for training support vector machines",
        "An efficient and adaptive granular-ball generation method in classification problem",
        "Graph-based representation for image based on granular-ball",
        "Granular-ball optimization algorithm",
        "Gbnrs: A novel rough set algorithm for fast adaptive attribute reduction in classification",
        "Gbrs: A unified granular-ball learning model of pawlak rough set and neighborhood rough set",
        "Granular ball sampling for noisy label classification or imbalanced classification",
        "An efficient spectral clustering algorithm based on granular-ball",
        "Complete random forest based class noise filtering learning for improving the generalizability of classifiers",
        "Relative density based support vector machine",
        "Classification with noisy labels by importance reweighting",
        "A tutorial on support vector machines for pattern recognition",
        "Kernel k-means: spectral clustering and normalized cuts",
        "mcrf and mrd: two classification methods based on a novel multiclass label noise filtering learning framework",
        "Spline adaptive filtering algorithm based on different iterative gradients: Performance analysis and comparison",
        "Practical bipartite consensus for multi-agent systems: A barrier function-based adaptive sliding-mode control approach",
        "Sampled-data control through model-free reinforcement learning with effective experience replay",
        "Towards cognitive navigation: A biologically inspired calibration mechanism for the head direction cell network",
        "Cost-effective distributed ftfc for uncertain nonholonomic mobile robot fleet with collision avoidance and connectivity preservation",
        "Autonomous exploration using uwb and lidar",
        "Practical prescribed-time fuzzy tracking control for uncertain nonlinear systems with time-varying actuators faults",
        "Msfired-net: A lightweight and efficient convolutional neural network for flame and smoke segmentation",
        "A review on colregs-compliant navigation of autonomous surface vehicles: From traditional to learning-based approaches"
    ],
    "reasoning": "Selected these 52 references because they represent foundational work and recent advances in GBSVM: Granular-ball Support Vector Machine, providing essential background knowledge and methodological foundations relevant to this research."
}
